decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption through cards like Ragavan, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push. It utilizes a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and hand disruption to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes graveyard interaction with cards like Kroxa and Dauthi Voidwalker. The goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and finish them off quickly with powerful creatures and burn spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and curve out smoothly.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering and removing threats while maintaining card advantage. It utilizes a variety of counterspells like Force of Negation and Counterspell, as well as removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes card draw spells like Preordain and Archmage's Charm to ensure a steady stream of resources. Additionally, it includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Subtlety to close out the game. The mana base is built to support the deck's colors and optimize its spell casting potential.

This deck focuses on using a variety of cycling creatures and spells to fill the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. It also utilizes cards like Grief and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and establish a dominating board presence. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to execute Living End and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by removal like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Counterspell and Spell Pierce, while also utilizing card advantage from cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on, while also maintaining control of the board through counter spells and removal.

This control deck focuses on utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of colorless mana, allowing for the casting of huge threats like Horned Loch-Whale and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also runs a suite of counterspells like Force of Negation and Remand, as well as removal spells like Subtlety and Warping Wail to control the opponent's board. With access to powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Academy Ruins, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent in the late game while setting up for powerful finishers.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing cards like Architects of Will, Ardent Plea, Curator of Mysteries, and Generous Ent to manipulate the graveyard and cascade into powerful spells like Living End. By cycling through cards with Street Wraith and utilizing cards like Grief and Subtlety for disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Shardless Agent and Force of Negation for further control and protection. The inclusion of lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Otawara, Soaring City support the overall game plan of the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures through combo interactions and utilizing Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures in response to the opponent's actions. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician acts as a central piece of the combo, enabling powerful synergies with cards like Young Wolf and Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck also includes a range of utility creatures like Gilded Goose, Scavenging Ooze, and Orcish Bowmasters to provide answers to various threats. The mana base is designed to support the toolbox strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck aims to control the game by using a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and graveyard hate. It also looks to generate advantage through card advantage and board presence with powerful creatures like Karn, the Great Creator and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy color requirements and synergize with cards like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around out-valuing and outlasting the opponent through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.
